extractions.description: This research proposes methods to develop fair vaccination strategies for COVID-19 by leveraging influence maximization on mobility networks. It aims to optimize vaccine distribution by considering demographic aspects like race, social status, and age-associated risk factors, thereby addressing inequities in healthcare access.

title.value: Promoting Fair Vaccination Strategies Through Influence Maximization: A Case Study on COVID-19 Spread
title.justification: The title is explicit in naming the main focus of the research, which is promoting fair vaccination strategies using influence maximization, particularly in the context of COVID-19.
title.quote: [Promoting Fair Vaccination Strategies Through Influence Maximization: A Case Study on COVID-19 Spread]

type.justification: The study involves conducting extensive experiments on COVID-19 spread in three major metropolitan areas in the US, utilizing real aggregated visit data to validate their proposed approach.
type.quote: Through extensive experiments conducted on Covid-19 spread in three major metropolitan areas across the United States, we demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed approach in reducing disease transmission and promoting fairness in vaccination distribution.

research_field.justification: The research field is related to Deep Learning given the computational techniques and models employed for optimizing vaccination strategies through influence maximization on networks.
research_field.quote: We leverage an approach called influence maximization (IM), a network science technique designed to detect the most influential members of social networks, typically used in applications such as viral marketing campaigns.

sub_research_field.justification: Given the focus on addressing demographic fairness in vaccine distribution strategies, the sub-research field falls under fairness in AI.
sub_research_field.quote: By considering factors such as race, social status, age, and associated risk factors, we aim to optimize vaccine distribution to achieve various fairness definitions for one or more protected attributes at a time.

name.justification: The paper proposes using the influence maximization model to detect influential nodes in a network for optimal vaccine distribution.
name.quote: We leverage an approach called influence maximization (IM), a network science technique designed to detect the most influential members of social networks, typically used in applications such as viral marketing campaigns.

type.justification: Influence Maximization is categorized as a network science technique aimed at identifying key nodes within a network to optimize impact, in this case for vaccination.
type.quote: Influence Maximization IM is a network science technique used to identify the most influential nodes in a graph, with respect to their ability to propagate a certain transmissible quality, such as information or disease.

name.justification: The paper introduces a model specific for simulating COVID-19 spread within mobility networks, essential for their vaccination strategy.
name.quote: We use the Covid-19 simulation proposed by Chang et al. (Chang et al. 2020), which models the propagation of the disease on the network of CBGs and POIs.

type.justification: The COVID-19 Propagation Model is a simulation model used to mimic the spread of COVID-19 in a network to evaluate vaccination strategies.
type.quote: We use the Covid-19 simulation proposed by Chang et al. (Chang et al. 2020), which models the propagation of the disease on the network of CBGs and POIs.

name.justification: SafeGraph data is used to construct mobility networks essential for modeling disease spread and evaluating vaccination strategies.
name.quote: We conduct experiments on three mobility networks of MSAs in the US, constructed from individual mobile tracking data from SafeGraph, from the Dewey platform (SafeGraph 2023).

name.justification: NumPy likely plays a fundamental role in data handling and numerical computations required in the study.
name.quote: The code can be found here: github.com/nicolaneo/fair_vaccination_with_im.

name.justification: Pandas is essential for data manipulation tasks performed in this empirical research.
name.quote: The code can be found here: github.com/nicolaneo/fair_vaccination_with_im.

name.justification: SciPy is used for advanced scientific computations that support influence maximization and vaccination strategy simulations.
name.quote: The code can be found here: github.com/nicolaneo/fair_vaccination_with_im.

name.justification: Scikit-learn is likely used for modeling and analytical purposes within the research.
name.quote: The code can be found here: github.com/nicolaneo/fair_vaccination_with_im.
